tei.text:
DOI: 10.1002/zaac.200700527
Synthesis and Structure of the Novel Pentaselenidohexaarsenate(I,II) Cluster
Anion [As 6 Se 5 ] 2؊
Anna Kromm and William S. Sheldrick*
Bochum, Lehrstuhl für Analytische Chemie der Ruhr-Universität Bochum
Received November 26 th , 2007.
Abstract. Methanolothermal reaction of [MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )] with
As 2 Se 3 at 150°C in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 affords violet-coloured
[Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]As 6 Se 5 (1). Its novel tricyclic selenidoarsenate(I,II)
anion [As 6 Se 5 ] 2Ϫ contains two five-membered [As 3 As(Se)Se] rings
that are symmetry-related by a crystallographic C 2 axis passing
through the common As I -As I bond between their respective first
A variety of discrete multinuclear chalcogenidoarsenate and -anti-
monate anions containing trivalent arsenic or antimony atoms have
been isolated from solvothermal solutions in the presence of large
counter cations [1Ϫ3]. For instance, corner-sharing condensation
of pyramidal [AE 3 ] 3Ϫ anions (A ϭ As, Sb; E ϭ S, Se) can lead to
the formation of cyclic chalcogenidometalate(III) anions
[{AE 2 } n ] nϪ , for which examples are known with n ϭ 2 (A ϭ As,
E ϭ S [4]; A ϭ Sb, E ϭ S [5], Se [4]), n ϭ 3 (A ϭ As, E ϭ S [6,
7], Se [8, 9]; A ϭ Sb, E ϭ S [10]) and n ϭ 4 (A ϭ As, E ϭ Se [11];
A ϭ Sb, E ϭ S [12]). Corner-sharing has also been reported for
dinuclear anions (A ϭ As, Sb; E ϭ S, Se) of the type [A 2 E 5 ] 4Ϫ in
complexes [M(en) 3 ] 2 A 2 E 5 (M ϭ Mn, Fe, Ni [13Ϫ17]; en ϭ ethylene-
diamine) and for the linear tetranuclear [Sb 4 Se 9 ] 6Ϫ anion in
Cs 6 Sb 4 Se 9 • 0.5H 2 O [18].
Cluster anions containing both A-E-A linkages and direct A-A
bonds have been characterized for species containing 4, 7 and
10Ϫ12 arsenic atoms, and 4 and 6 antimony atoms. The ubiquitous
bicyclic [A 4 E 6 ] 2Ϫ anions (A ϭ As, Sb; E ϭ S, Se) [3, 19Ϫ21] can
be regarded as being derived from a realgar-like A 4 E 4 structure by
addition of chalcogenide anions at two opposite A atoms in the
A 4 E 4 basket and concomitant cleavage of their transannular A-A
bond. In the related [Sb 6 S 6 ] 2Ϫ anion of (PPh 4 ) 2 Sb 6 S 6 [21], the re-
maining transannular bond of the bicyclic [Sb 4 S 6 ] 2Ϫ anion is re-
placed by an Sb 4 rectangle. Cyclic [As 4 Te 6 ] 4Ϫ anions containing a
six-membered (As 2 Te) 2 ring are present in [Ba(en) 4 ] 2 As 4 Te 6 [22] and
[enH 2 ]As 4 Te 6 • 2en [23] and cage-like chalcogenidoarsenate anions
of nuclearity n ϭ 7 and 10 have been characterised in respectively
(PPh 4 )As 7 Se 4 [24] and the compounds [K(2.2.2-crypt)] 2 As 10 S 3 [3]
(2.2.2-crypt ϭ 4,7,13,16,21,24-hexaoxa-1,10-diazabicyclo[8.8.8]-
hexacosane) and (PPh 4 ) 2 As 10 E 3 (E ϭ Se [25], Te [26]). The struc-
* Prof. Dr. W. S. Sheldrick
Lehrstuhl für Analytische Chemie
Ruhr-Universität Bochum
D-44780 Bochum

820

Z. Anorg. Allg. Chem. 2008, 634, 820Ϫ822
two ring members. The adjacent As I atoms in the individual rings
are bridged by the Se atom of the third [As 4 Se] ring.
Keywords: Selenidoarsenate; Manganese; Cluster anion; Solvother-
mal synthesis; Crystal structure
Fig. 1 The molecular structure of the [As 6 Se 5 ] 2Ϫ anion of 1
showing the atom numbering scheme [symmetry code A: 3/2 Ϫx,
Ϫy, z].
Selected bond lengths/Å and angles/°: As1-Se1 2.308(3), As1-Se2 2.449(3),
As1-As2 2.417(3), As2-Se3 2.374(3), As2-As3a 2.430(3), As3-Se2 2.381(3),
As3-As3a 2.450(4); Se1-As1-As2 92.28(11), Se1-As1-Se2 104.88(10),
As2-As1-Se2 99.67(10), Se3-As2-As1 101.67(10), Se3-As2-As3a 103.34(11),
As1-As2 As3a 96.57(9), Se2-As3-As2a 100.05(10), Se2-As3-As3a 97.52(12),
As2a-As3-As3a 98.88(8), As3-Se2-As1 109.44(10), As2a-Se3-As2 107.45(14)
tures of the latter [As 10 E 3 ] 3Ϫ anions are based on that of the tris-
homocubane-like [As 11 ] 3Ϫ anion [27], as is that of [As 11 Te] 3Ϫ in
[K(2.2.2-crypt)] 3 As 11 Te • en [28]. A nuclearity n ϭ 12 has been re-
ported for [As 12 Se 4 ] 4Ϫ in [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2 As 12 Se • 12NH 3 [29]. Pyrami-
dal [AE 3 ] 3Ϫ anions can also link through E-E bonds as observed
in cyclic [A 2 E 6 ] 2Ϫ anions (A ϭ As, E ϭ Se [29]; A ϭ Sb, E ϭ Se
[30]) and chainlike 1
ϱ [AsSe 3
Ϫ ] polymers [31].
We now report the synthesis and structure of [Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]
As 6 Se 5 (1) (9-ane-N 3 ϭ 1,4,7-triazacyclononane), whose novel
pentaselenidohexaarsenate(I,II) cluster anion is depicted in Figure
1. Violet crystals of 1 were prepared by methanolothermal reaction
of [MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )] with As 2 Se 3 in an equimolar ratio at a tem-
perature of 150°C in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 as a mineralizer. It
Novel Pentaselenidohexaarsenate(I,II) Cluster Anion [As 6 Se 5 ] 2Ϫ
is interesting to note that the analogous solvothermal reaction of
[MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )] with elemental As and Se in H 2 O/CH 3 OH (1/1)
at a 1:1:2 molar ratio leads to formation of [Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]As 2 Se 6
in 70 % yield [32]. The tricyclic [As 6 Se 5 ] 2Ϫ anion exhibits crystallo-
graphic C 2 symmetry with the twofold axis passing through Se3
and the centre of the As3-As3a bond. It contains three five-
membered As 4 Se rings and can be regarded as being related to
the bicyclic [As 4 Se 6 ] 2Ϫ anion of [K(2.2.2-crypt)] 2 As 4 Se 6 [3] and
(PPh 4 ) 2 As 4 Se 6 [33] with As2 and As2a replacing Se atoms and
being linked by an additional atom Se3. The terminal As1-Se1
distance is much shorter [2.308(3) Å ] than those observed for the
endocyclic As-Se bonds [2.374(3)Ϫ2.449(3) Å ] and As-As distances
within the As 6 chain lie in the range 2.417(3)Ϫ2.450(4) Å .
On ignoring longer As-Se interactions greater than 2.63 Å , the
structure of the [As 7 Se 4 ] Ϫ anion in (PPh 4 )As 7 Se 4 [24] can also be
related to the realgar-like atom arrangement in As 4 Se 4 , in this case
by replacing both Se atoms of one of the As 3 Se 2 rings by As atoms
and then bridging these by an As(Se)Se unit. As both [K(2.2.2-
crypt)] 2 As 4 Se 6 and (PPh 4 )As 7 Se 4 were, indeed, prepared from
As 4 Se 4 under reducing conditions (K/NH 3 and K/en), such a struc-
tural relationship is to be expected. It is more surprising for the
[As 6 Se 5 ] 2Ϫ anions of [Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]As 6 Se 5 as no reducing agent
was present for the methanolothermal reaction. However, it should
be noted that disproportionation reactions are rather typical for
reactions carried out on As/Se systems in superheated methanol
[34]. For instance hydrothermally synthesized CsAsSe 3 • 0.5H 2 O
[31] disproportionates to the polymeric selenidoarsenate(II,III)
Cs 2 As 4 Se 6 , the cyclic selenidoarsenate(III) Cs 4 As 4 Se 8 [11], and the
selenidoarsenates(V) Cs 2 [As(CH 3 )Se 3 ] • 2H 2 O and Cs[As(CH 3 ) 2 Se 2 ]
[35] in methanol at 190°C [36]. The 1
ϱ [As 4 Se 6
2Ϫ ] chains of
Cs 2 As 4 Se 6 can be regarded as being constructed from discrete bi-
cyclic [As 4 Se 6 ] 2Ϫ anions by cleavage of an endocyclic As-Se bond
and concomitant formation of new As-Se bonds to adjacent units
in the resulting 1D polyanion [36]. We did not study the compo-
sition of the mother liquor for the reaction of[MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )]
with As 2 Se 3 but assume that it will once again contain As V anions
such as those of [As(CH 3 )Se 3 ] 2Ϫ and [As(CH 3 ) 2 Se 2 ] Ϫ obtained by
the disproportionation of CsAsSe 3 • 0.5H 2 O in superheated meth-
anol.
Experimental Section
The starting compound [MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )] was prepared in accord-
ance with the literature procedure [37].
[Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]As 6 Se 5 (1)
150.6 mg of [MnCl 3 (9-ane-N 3 )] (0.52 mmol) was tempered in a
sealed glass tube at 150°C for 25 h in 1 ml methanol together with
201.1 mg As 2 Se 3 (0.52 mmol) and 165.3 mg Cs 2 CO 3 (0.51 mmol).
Slow cooling to 20°C at 1°C/h afforded violet crystals of
[Mn(9-ane-N 3 ) 2 ]As 6 Se 5 (1) in 15 % yield (45.2 mg). EDX measure-
ments on a LEO 1530 Gemini were in accordance with the expected
1:6:5 ratio for Mn:As:Se.
X-ray structural analyses
(1), Siemens P4 diffractometer, 294(2) K, orthorhombic Pnna, a ϭ
12.729(6), b ϭ 18.845(5), c ϭ 11.798(3) Å , V ϭ 2830.1(17) Å 3 , Z ϭ
4, M ϭ 1157.7, D c ϭ 2.717 Mg • m Ϫ3 , μ ϭ 13.87 mm Ϫ1 , F(000) ϭ

821
2148. Intensity data were collected with ω-scans in the range 2.04
Յ θ Յ 25.0°for a crystal of dimensions 0.45 x 0.17 x 0.16 mm
using MoKα radiation (λ ϭ 0.71073 Å ) and corrected for absorp-
tion with γ scan data. The structure was solved by direct methods
and refined against F o
2 with SHELX-97 [38] to R 1 ϭ 0.074
[I > 2σ(I)], wR 2 ϭ 0.184 (all data) for 2463 independent reflections
[39]. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically. H atoms
were constrained to idealized positions and refined using a riding
model, with d(N-H) ϭ 0.91 and d(C-H) ϭ 0.97 Å , and with U iso
(H) ϭ 1.2 U eq (N) or 1.2 U eq (C). The highest peak of residual elec-
tron density (1.06 e • Å Ϫ3 ) is located 1.08 Å from Se1 and the deep-
est hole (Ϫ0.90 e • Å Ϫ3 ) 0.70 Å from Se3.
